definition: everything is fine (idiom); all is well with the world
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
lucky/giga- (meaning billion or 10^9)
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: Just get a cool tool and we're set".
sentences.chinese: 只要找到一个酷酷的工具就万事大吉了”。

sentences.english: If you see the clock, all is well.
sentences.chinese: 如果看到时钟，则万事大吉了。

sentences.english: And please don’t think adding in a clever kissy smiley face will help matters at all.
sentences.chinese: 别以为加了一个亲吻的笑脸就万事大吉。

sentences.english: Just wait until later on in the day after Mercury turns direct to make any move.
sentences.chinese: 只要等到水星顺行之后行动就万事大吉。

sentences.english: As long as she did this, all would be well.
sentences.chinese: 只要能做到这一点她就可以万事大吉。

sentences.english: Dont worry! Mate, once he get here, Bob's your uncle.
sentences.chinese: 别着急，伙计，等他来了就万事大吉了。

sentences.english: The police are checking on every passenger to make sure that everything is all right.
sentences.chinese: 警察在对每位旅客进行检查，以保万事大吉。

sentences.english: Surely, it's stupid to believe that everything will be fine because we survived this time.
sentences.chinese: 我们可千万不能以为躲过了这一招就万事大吉了。

sentences.english: Just, juvenile everything revolves around her, she's okay and everything will be fine.
sentences.chinese: 只是，少年的一切都以她为中心，她没事便万事大吉。

sentences.english: And besides, we should not replace a filament bulb with a low-energy one and be done with it .
sentences.chinese: 再者，我们不能认为就是把节能灯换上就万事大吉了。

definition: everything is finished (idiom); And there you are!
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to get sth done once and for all
As You Like It, comedy by Shakespeare
to everyone's delight and satisfaction
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
if only/so long as
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
lit. (bamboo) splits when it meets the knife's edge (idiom)/fig. easily solved
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
successfully accomplished (project or goal)/to be highly successful
to have one's wishes come true/wish you the best!
to have a lucky stroke/to try one's luck
half the work, twice the effect (idiom); the right approach saves effort and leads to better results/a stitch in time saves nine
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
to earn a fortune
